lib/ Anna/ Log.pm

Returns an instance of Anna::Log, which allows for logging to that specific location.

An instance-method that operates on log-instances.

Functions

new

sub new

Returns an instance of Anna::Log, which allows for logging to that specific location. new Anna::Log must be called with named parameters like this

new Anna::Log(
  heap    => $heap,
  format  => 'msg',
  network => $network,
  target  => $channel
);

or like this (if you’re logging a service)

new Anna::Log(
  heap    => $heap,
  format  => 'service',
  name    => 'foobarmodule'
);

Parameters

heapa POE heap-reference
formattype of log (either service or msg)
networkthe name of the network we’re connected to
targetthe target from which we log (channel, user, etc).
namethe name of the service to log

Returns

a blessed reference to a log-instance

write

sub write

An instance-method that operates on log-instances.  Writes the given message to the logfile your object points to (be it a service or target)

Parameters

messagethe message to write

Returns

1 on success and 0 on failure (note, if logging is disabled alltogether, it will still return 1)
Generated by Natural Docs
